newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Aeroflot to curtail variety of its jets.
newsitem.headline: Aeroflot to curtail variety of its jets.

text.p: Russia's international flagship carrier Aeroflot plans to streamline its fleet to improve cost efficiencies, the company's director said on Thursday.
Yevgeny Shaposnikov told a news conference that the company would gradually eliminate seven types of aircraft, leaving them just three different models in their fleet.
"We plan to operate Ilyushin-96 long-range jets powered by U.S.-made engines, Tupolev-204 medium-range jets and Boeing 737 aircraft for short-range flights," Shaposhnikov said.
Shaposhnikov declined to say when Aeroflot confirmed its order to buy ten 737 jets from Boeing Co. "We are in talks with the company," he said.
Aeroflot now operates 120 aircraft of ten different models, forcing it to spend a lot of money on repairs and maintenance, Shaposnikov said.
